title: so , 7 wins in row , by rito logic means...
body:
that i have to be humiliated by tryharding platinum 3 player in normals , and all this in iron and bronze players environment

this shows how the only real balance issue is the matchmaking itself.... all along

replies.body:
I mean, this sort of system is the only real way to drive up smurfs leveling up alternative accounts, they will have ungodly winrates which sees them put into much higher mmr brackets as quickly as possible to ensure they dont bully the people who actually are new. 


But indeed the unfortunate side effect is indeed that a non smurf who archives a high winrate will indeed see their MMR rise rapidly thus putting them into higher MMR brackets as well, resulting in a near certain beatdown.

....

Well i cant think of any better solutions and all i can think of to say is that its unfortunate.

I still don't understand why they don't make ranks based on MMR. After all, it is the deciding factor for someone's progress in ranks and it would somewhat make these situations more understandable. 

From the perspective of a player who can only see his/her division, this seems like a really stupid and unreasonable matchmaking error.

Each division corresponds with a certain MMR bracket though.

https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-en/ONXtEyFR-estimated-mmr-values-of-each-and-every-division-placements-explained

If your MMR rises a lot over your current position as you play you will see yourself skipping ranks when you succeed a promo.

> [{quoted}](name=Thefrostyviking,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQ96FPn5,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2019-02-09T01:29:55.761+0000)
>
> If your MMR rises a lot over your current position as you play you will see yourself skipping ranks when you succeed a promo.

And here is one of the main problems with this system: promos. The match-making during those games is one of the worst experiences one can ever have (from my perspective). 

I had the occasion to skip a few ranks before and I understand that it helps in maintaining a division representative of one's MMR, but it doesn't completely reflect the player's current skill level. A player may come back after a few months and have a low MMR, but still maintain their position, or is on a win-streak that has high MMR but low division. MMR is always changing and that is how divisions should work too.

> Each division corresponds with a certain MMR bracket though.

What I ask for is to have a ranking system based solely on MMR as a score. Each division would be representative of a percentage of the top players, or a bracket of MMR scores. Every time one loses/wins, they get to see how their MMR is affected, not an "LP" change, which is actually based on MMR.

In the end, I want clarity. The current system simply works based on hidden variables that, imo, would better explain the matchmaking system. People complain about fighting higher divisions all the time for example, ignoring the small difference in MMR they have and blame the system for "unfair" games. And I would love to stop hearing people saying "those guys are better than us because they are higher division" at the start of games...

Because people would complain that their rank changes every 2 games and how they fell out of gold the last day of ranked so they don't get the rewards. Personally I'm all for completely removing rank and then giving out rewards based on the highest achieved tier of the season.

> [{quoted}](name=Thefrostyviking,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PQ96FPn5,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-02-08T22:13:03.419+0000)
> But indeed the unfortunate side effect is indeed that a non smurf who archives a high winrate will indeed see their MMR rise rapidly thus putting them into higher MMR brackets as well, resulting in a near certain beatdown.

That's where you're wrong, kiddo.

The consequence of winning a bunch isn't that you get put in an MMR drastically above your own, it causes the the entire enemy team to be a whole tier above your own and for your team to die 4-man in the jungle before minions spawn.

All of your first paragraph is fine. I get that. It makes sense.. But..

Why does the same system give you players in your team that are nowhere near as strong as opponents? Why the MMR of enemies is always superior, yet MMR of either your whole team or individual players so much lower?

That's the problem imo. It isn't just puts you in harder games, but makes sure you are forcefully dragged down "just to keep happy 50%~ WR"

I mean,  i cant say for everyone but what usually happens for me on a true winstreak in ranked is that i get thrown into a game where all my opponents are peak gold-plati and pretty much everyone will be appropriately ranked for it, except me who is currently g2, odd exception of someone else being on a winstreak also joining in at times. 

The restriction of being unable to play with people a certain level above yourself in ranked ensures that there usually isnt a very large difference even if your MMR jumps up, and should you keep winning? Promo into rank skipping until you stop winning so much.

But i do admit that things can get hella crazy in normals though, actually managed to get into a game where the enemy team had 4 diamonds, 1 master and my side had 3 diamonds, 1 winstreak plati 1 and then gold me on a longer streak as well.-......although they were playing offroles but damn still.

You just exactly portrayed the situation with MMR. If you are on a roll the game literally bats you to death for going up and the increase in difficult enemies is ridiculous. RIOT needs a system to properly detect smurfs based on KDA and winrates so they get either ranked up even faster, or just make a seperate matchmaking detection.

Thing is, when you are winning a number of games in a row often times you are doing well, snowballing or just having very solid scores in many of those matches, your KDA will look good.

Having a bad KDA and high winrate is .....pretty unlikely unless playing something weird like the anti tower Sion. 


Besides if you lose a few games in a row the system usually realizes that it threw you too far so you get moved down a bit, it has been reliable enough in my case and i just saw those games as a chance to see if i couldnt try to improve myself against superior opponents.

Well the problem is, if you want to get better you need a challenge in logical increments. Games are either a piece of cake or utter unplayable because your botlane goes 0/5 in 10 minutes, or you find yourself getting stomped by smurfs, and if you have even more  bad luck you can run into teammates that deliberately try to ruin the game by letting teammates die and stand there to watch other people suffer. If you are Lucky your enemy team will have these issues. Having decent behaviour in-game does help. All these factors combined make LOL a very roll of the dice kind of game. Even when you are are extremely good at the game, there are brick walls waiting for you. Like i said, decent behaviour in-game helps TONS. League of Behaviour. I've noticed showing remorse for mistakes also boosts team morale a bit, if you point fingers that's where people get this: "you are not my dad" trigger.

Certainly games that are out of control do occur, smurfs are in large part a reason for this as are disconnects, bad internet and trolls.

But even so i find that many of my games are still fair enough most of the time, i wont say that i do not encounter the above things as i do, but i still get to enjoy mostly good games so i dont think i can complain too much.
thats really. not at all the problem.

>that i have to be humiliated by tryharding platinum 3 player in **normals** , and all this in iron and bronze players environment

Ranked and normals don´t use the same mmr (if I remember correctly). A challenger who plays only ranked could have an iron mmr in normals cause he never played normals. Despite that normals has less restrictions than ranked which makes it again harder (3-5 premades with varying mmr between each of them).

Pretty much this, except that ranked MMR does influence MMR in normals to some extent. I don't think anyone that hasn't seen the formula can guess it, but Riot has said before that rank influences matchmaking in normals some but not too much.

Obviously, and theres nothing rigged about it.

If you achieve a high wr you will climb untill you start losing. This means you've met your match and hit the ELO you belong in, hence your winrate goes back towards 50%.

This is how it **should** work, not how it actually works.

Pretty easy to check:

* Since stomps are far more frequent than balanced games;
* since games often are one-sided since the beginning, before snowballing effects can happen;

and,

* since there is *no gradualness* at all in the difficulty of the games you find (far better opponents - far worse opponents),

You know, that’s kinda the definition of «matchmaking». It strives to match you against players of equal skill.

A 50% winrate TECHNICALLY means matchmaking is doing it’s job perfectly. You’re being matched against players at your exact skill level, resulting in an equal number of wins and losses.

Technically yes, it's ok: 50% is perfect.

BUT, it is achieved NOT by matching you with opponents at your exact skill level. It's the **opposite**. 
_You either get stomped, or you stomp them_. This happens **so often** that cannot be by accident.

They force a 50% wr as far as possbile, for example to make you play more, and that is disgusting.

If you think that this kind of matchmaking is fair, resulting in a 10%-20% of balanced matches at most, have fun :)

See, what I don't understand is why the system makes ridiculous assumptions. 

For example, if I go on a 4 game win streak, the system *assumes* I am actually higher skilled than my  rank, and thus my MMR is high. Then the system will pair me with higher ranked opponents to see if I can win that. At least, this is how I understand it. 

My question is: Since when does a small winstreak automatically make me a tier higher? This is why the system seems stupid to me. Why am I punished for actually winning games?

It helps when you remember that the rank literally doesn't matter, only the MMR does. The rank isn't used anywhere for matchmaking calculation - that applies to both you and your opponents within reason. MMR has its primary inputs being wins and losses - so if you go on a hot streak, you will necessarily wind up matched against harder opponents. That's the whole point.

Ad I'm fine with being paired against higher opponents, but why am I getting much lower skilled TEAMMATES on my teams? I had unranked players in one of my games last night. I'd be fine being paired against higher skilled opponents, as long as my own team is equal.
